contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Hatnote|This article is about the former town in Hyōgo Prefecture, Japan. There is another town with the same name in [[Saga Prefecture]], see [[Kanzaki, Saga]] and a town with the same [[Japanese language|Japanese]] name in [[Chiba Prefecture]], see [[Kozaki, Chiba]].}} {{Nihongo|'''Kanzaki'''|神崎町|Kanzaki-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Kanzaki District, Hyōgo|Kanzaki District]], [[Hyōgo Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On November 7, 2005 Kanzaki was merged with the town of [[Ōkawachi, Hyōgo|Ōkawachi]], also from [[Kanzaki District, Hyōgo|Kanzaki District]], to form the new town of [[Kamikawa, Hyōgo|Kamikawa]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 8,238 and a [[population density|density]] of 78.38 persons per km². The total area was 105.10 km². {{DEFAULTSORT:Kanzaki, Hyogo}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hyōgo Prefecture]] {{Hyogo-geo-stub}}
